topIssues.title: Error: No handler found for delegate type: TEXT_EMBEDDING with OpenAI
topIssues.author: Kirstygoodary
topIssues.body:
Having issues in the chat, when writing the message getting this error: 

```
file:///Users/../.nvm/versions/node/v23.3.0/lib/node_modules/@elizaos/cli/dist/chunk-GFPVHNVN.js:46822
      throw new Error(`No handler found for delegate type: ${modelKey}`);
            ^
```
```
Error: No handler found for delegate type: TEXT_EMBEDDING
```

I've added the open api key to .env. 

On line 45459 in `chunk-GFPVHNVN.js`  - `TEXT_EMBEDDING: "TEXT_EMBEDDING"`,  is being used as the `modelKey` it seems. 
is this right for `modelType`? 

Also tried `rm -rf ~/.eliza` and restarted.

topIssues.title: pglite log entry unicode escape error
topIssues.author: plvo
topIssues.body:
**Describe the bug**

When attempting to create a log entry with the `useModel:TEXT_LARGE` type, the operation fails due to an `unsupported Unicode escape sequence` error. This results in the log entry not being created, impacting the reliability of our tracking system.

**To Reproduce**

Steps to reproduce the behavior:

1. Trigger a model usage event of type `useModel:TEXT_LARGE`.
2. Ensure that the payload contains a string with an invalid Unicode escape (e.g. malformed `\u` sequence).
3. Observe the failure to log the event.

**Expected behavior**

The log entry should be created successfully, or the input should be sanitized/validated to prevent the escape sequence error.

**Screenshots**

N/A

**Additional context**

Here is the error output:

```
[2025-05-05 21:44:53] ERROR: Failed to create log entry:
    type: "useModel:TEXT_LARGE"
    roomId: "964d1ca6-29f9-00e0-b2c6-b16caf5bbed7"
    entityId: "964d1ca6-29f9-00e0-b2c6-b16caf5bbed7"
    error: "unsupported Unicode escape sequence"

# ... drizzle error


error: unsupported Unicode escape sequence
    at ye.Ve (file:///workspaces/x/agent/node_modules/@electric-sql/pglite/dist/chunk-EADU5A67.js:1:17602)
    at ye.nt (file:///workspaces/x/agent/node_modules/@electric-sql/pglite/dist/chunk-EADU5A67.js:1:14988)
    at ye.parse (file:///workspaces/x/agent/node_modules/@electric-sql/pglite/dist/chunk-EADU5A67.js:1:13740)
    at pe.execProtocol (file:///workspaces/x/agent/node_modules/@electric-sql/pglite/dist/index.js:3:239489)
    at process.processTicksAndRejections (node:internal/process/task_queues:105:5)
    at async pe.l (file:///workspaces/x/agent/node_modules/@electric-sql/pglite/dist/chunk-A7RFOIQ7.js:8:1911)
    at async file:///workspaces/x/agent/node_modules/@electric-sql/pglite/dist/chunk-A7RFOIQ7.js:8:2407 {
  length: 250,
  severity: 'ERROR',
  code: '22P05',
  detail: '\\u0000 cannot be converted to text.',
  hint: undefined,
  position: undefined,
  internalPosition: undefined,
  internalQuery: undefined,
  where: 'JSON data, line 1: ...n environnement virtuel :\\"}}],\\n          \\u0000...\n' +
    "unnamed portal parameter $2 = '...'",
  schema: undefined,
  table: undefined,
  column: undefined,
  dataType: undefined,
  constraint: undefined,
  file: 'jsonfuncs.c',
  line: '638',
  routine: 'json_errsave_error'
}


```

This seems to be triggered during JSON parsing or serialization, potentially from malformed input data that includes a broken escape like `\u`.

topIssues.title: Agent Hangs After Core Init / REST API Bind (Anthropic + Twitter Config)
topIssues.author: kunleulysses
topIssues.body:
Environment:
OS: Ubuntu 22.04.5 LTS (on VPS)
Node.js Version: v23.11.0 (installed via NVM)
pnpm Version: v9.15.0
ElizaOS Installation Method: Manual Monorepo Clone (git clone https://github.com/elizaos/eliza.git)
ElizaOS Version: Checked out to latest tag (Likely v0.25.9 based on agent package version in logs)

Key Packages:
@elizaos/agent: v0.25.9
@elizaos/core: Likely v0.25.9 (based on agent)
@elizaos/plugin-twitter: 0.25.6-alpha.1 (or version installed via @latest)
@elizaos/plugin-anthropic: 1.0.0-alpha.0 (or version installed via @latest)
Hardware: VPS with 3GB RAM

Problem Description:
The ElizaOS agent process successfully initializes its core components but hangs indefinitely immediately after the Direct Client REST API binds to its port (e.g., 3000). This occurs when configured to use a custom character (flappy.character.json) located in a root characters/ directory, with the goal of using the Anthropic model provider (@elizaos/plugin-anthropic) and the Twitter client (@elizaos/plugin-twitter) with auto-interactions enabled.
The logs show successful character loading, correct plugin identification (@elizaos/plugin-twitter, @elizaos/plugin-anthropic), selection of "anthropic" as the model provider, database connection, and REST API binding. However, the process never proceeds to the expected Twitter client initialization logs (Creating default Twitter client..., Successfully logged in., Start Hanldeling Twitter Timeline, etc.) or any Anthropic-related activity. The process does not crash or exit; it simply stalls.

Steps to Reproduce:
(Based on troubleshooting sequence followed)
Clean VPS environment.
Install prerequisites: Node v23.11.0 (via NVM), pnpm v9.15.0, git, build-essential.
Clone the main eliza monorepo: git clone https://github.com/elizaos/eliza.git && cd eliza.
Check out the latest stable tag: git checkout $(git describe --tags --abbrev=0).
Create and configure ~/eliza/.env with valid Twitter API credentials (Key, Secret, Access Token, Secret) and a valid Anthropic API Key. Ensure ENABLE_TWITTER_POST_GENERATION=true and ENABLE_ACTION_PROCESSING=true. Ensure conflicting AI providers (USE_LOCAL_AI, USE_OLLAMA_TEXT_MODELS, OPENAI_API_KEY, etc.) are explicitly set to false or commented out.
Create a ~/eliza/characters/ directory.
Create ~/eliza/characters/flappy.character.json configured with "clients": ["twitter"], "plugins": ["@elizaos/plugin-twitter", "@elizaos/plugin-anthropic"], "modelProvider": "anthropic", and a specific "model": "claude-3-haiku-20240307". Include Twitter interaction settings under settings.twitter.
Create ~/eliza/characters/flappy.agent.json pointing to the character file.
Install dependencies: pnpm install.
Ensure correct plugins are installed and linked to the agent package:
pnpm remove @elizaos/plugin-local-ai (if present)
pnpm add @elizaos/plugin-anthropic@latest -F @elizaos/agent
pnpm add @elizaos/plugin-twitter@latest -F @elizaos/agent
pnpm install
Build the project: pnpm build.
Start the agent: pnpm start --characters="characters/flappy.character.json".

Expected Result:
The agent starts fully, logs confirm Twitter login and timeline handling begins, and subsequent AI tasks utilize the Anthropic API via the loaded plugin. The process remains active and responsive.

Actual Result:
The agent process hangs indefinitely after the SUCCESS: REST API bound to... log message. No further logs related to Twitter client initialization, AI provider interaction, or timeline handling appear. The process doesn't exit or crash.


``` Relevant Logs:

[2025-05-08 01:16:54] SUCCESS: REST API bound to 0.0.0.0:3000. If running locally, access it at http://localhost:3000.
# <-- HANGS HERE -->

Log
Configuration:
.env (Relevant Sections):
# --- Twitter/X Configuration ---
TWITTER_USERNAME=featherweightai
# TWITTER_PASSWORD=********* # Masked
# TWITTER_EMAIL=********* # Masked
# TWITTER_API_KEY=********* # Masked
# TWITTER_API_SECRET=********* # Masked
# TWITTER_ACCESS_TOKEN=********* # Masked
# TWITTER_ACCESS_SECRET=********* # Masked
ENABLE_TWITTER_POST_GENERATION=true
ENABLE_ACTION_PROCESSING=true

# --- Anthropic Configuration ---
ANTHROPIC_API_KEY=sk-ant-...#### # <<< IMPORTANT: Make sure this is correct
# ANTHROPIC_API_URL=

# --- Disabled Providers ---
USE_LOCAL_AI=false
USE_OLLAMA_TEXT_MODELS=false
# OPENAI_API_KEY=
# GAIA_API_KEY=
# ... etc other providers blank/commented ...
Use code [with caution](https://support.google.com/legal/answer/13505487).
Dotenv
characters/flappy.character.json (Relevant Sections):
{
  "name": "Flappy",
  // ... Bio/Lore/Examples/Style ...
  "clients": [
    "twitter"
  ],
  "plugins": [
    "@elizaos/plugin-twitter",
    "@elizaos/plugin-anthropic"
  ],
  "modelProvider": "anthropic", // Lowercase
  "model": "claude-3-haiku-20240307",
  "settings": {
    "secrets": {},
    "twitter": {
      "enable_replies": true,
      "enable_timeline_search": false,
      "enable_follow_thanks": true,
      "enable_auto_retweet": false
    }
  }
  // ...
}

Additional Context / Troubleshooting Steps Taken:
Issue persists even after regenerating Twitter API keys/tokens and confirming "Read, Write and access Direct Messages" permissions are set correctly in the Twitter Dev Portal (OAuth 1.0a).
Issue occurred similarly when trying to configure GAIA via Ollama settings (using plugin-local-ai, modelProvider: "OLLAMA"), hanging at the same point.
Removing both Twitter and AI plugins allowed the agent core to start without hanging (in previous testing phases), suggesting the issue occurs during plugin/client initialization after the core runtime is up.
Network connectivity to api.anthropic.com was verified via curl from the VPS (connection succeeded, though curl syntax errors prevented full request validation).
VPS has 3GB RAM, eliminating the previous RAM constraint issue encountered with local models.
Explicitly adding the required plugins (plugin-twitter, plugin-anthropic) as dependencies to the @elizaos/agent package using pnpm add -F @elizaos/agent ... successfully resolved earlier "Cannot find package" errors during plugin loading.

Updated MessageManager to handle empty messages and modified utility functions to return empty strings for null inputs, ensuring robustness in message processing.

topContributors.summary: wtfsayo: Merged 32 PRs this month with significant contributions to environment handling (PR #4445, +1734/-1067 lines), plugin system improvements (PR #4423, +1187/-3455 lines), and authentication middleware (PR #4420, +707/-346 lines). Focused heavily on bug fixes and code cleanup, particularly around PGLite migrations (PRs #4532, #4531), plugin loading (PR #4477, #4478), and environment resolution (PR #4547). Demonstrated consistent review activity with 13 reviews and 63 PR comments, while maintaining a pattern of occasional but substantial contributions across documentation updates, configuration improvements, and core functionality enhancements.

0xbbjoker: Led a significant monorepo cleanup effort by removing multiple plugins (including local-ai, ollama, groq, venice, redpill, anthropic, and others) through 10 PRs, resulting in substantial code reduction (-30k+ lines). Fixed several critical issues in the plugin system, including plugin installation commands (#4456), TTS manager and transcribe functionality (#4496), and build problems for Discord plugin (#4552). Made important improvements to the plugin-telegram by enabling strict types (#4559) and updating tests (#4570). Contributed actively but intermittently throughout the month, with 17 merged PRs and 5 open PRs focused on MySQL integration and testing improvements.

ChristopherTrimboli: Merged 11 PRs this month, with significant contributions including a major cleanup of memory-related code in PR #4467 (+873/-1804 lines) and implementing strict TypeScript typing with PR #4504 (+1361/-1262 lines). Actively reviewed other work with 19 PR reviews (14 approvals), while focusing on improving database operations with Drizzle ORM in PR #4500 and fixing various type errors and deprecated functions. His work primarily involved code refactoring, bug fixes, and infrastructure improvements, with 4 open PRs still pending review.

yungalgo: Focused on CLI improvements with 7 merged PRs (+3221/-5239 lines), including significant refactoring of the ElizaOS publish command (#4424), fixing version detection (#4435), and enhancing the agent command (#4560). Made substantial code changes across 125 files with 60 commits, primarily addressing bugfixes (27%) and adding new features (18%). Currently has 7 open PRs related to plugins and agent CLI commands, showing consistent work on improving command-line functionality.

K1mc4n: Focused on documentation work with one significant merged PR (#4488) that added Indonesian translation documentation with substantial changes (+57288/-24287 lines). Currently has 8 open PRs related to Indonesian documentation improvements, suggesting ongoing work to refine these translations. Created two open issues (#4565, #4561) related to CI and path problems with the documentation. Activity was sporadic, concentrated on just 4 days this month, with documentation files accounting for 87% of their changes.

odilitime: Made significant code contributions with 24 commits modifying 5,211 files (+223,140/-96,687 lines) across 5 days this month. Merged 3 PRs including bug fixes for plugin routes (#4415) and an unnecessary Express object (#4414), while opening 3 feature-focused PRs related to plugin specifications and database API improvements. Provided 9 code reviews with 6 approvals and contributed 5 PR comments, demonstrating active involvement in the review process. The substantial line changes suggest major refactoring or feature work, with documentation making up 42% of the modified files.

lalalune: Merged 4 significant PRs this month, including major bugfixes in PR #4515 (+16994/-19402 lines) and dependency updates in PR #4411 (+4392/-12278 lines), with sporadic activity across 5 days. Notable contributions include implementing small model usage for replies in PR #4416 and fixing BM25 in PR #4411, while also having an open PR (#4444) for plugin route fixes. Their work primarily focused on bugfixes (38%) and other improvements (52%), modifying 431 files across 21 commits with a balance of code (65%) and configuration (26%) changes.

samarth30: Contributed significantly with one large merged PR (#4471 "Feat/jimmy pm agent") that added over 287k lines and removed nearly 159k lines. Currently has three open PRs focused on feature work, including project manager functionality (#4462), a DevRel agent (#4499), and RAG system improvements (#4550). Modified 13 files across 9 commits with a primary focus on feature development (67%), showing sporadic activity on just 2 days this month.

tcm390: Made significant contributions to Twitter functionality, merging 3 PRs including a major Twitter timeline feature (#4429, +684/-2105 lines) and cleanup of Twitter-related code (#4430, removing 120 lines). Created and subsequently closed 2 Twitter-related issues (#4180, #4181) addressing spaces and interactions functionality. Actively reviewed other contributions with 7 reviews (6 approvals, 1 change request) despite being active on only 4 days this month.

standujar: Merged 3 PRs this month, including a feature for OpenAI plugin model usage events (#4438, +2409/-3824 lines), fixes for PGLite JSON serialization (#4458, +2042/-2710 lines), and a Discord service timeout fix (#4450, +199/-1016 lines). Made significant code reductions across 86 files with a net change of +262/-3290 lines, primarily focusing on bug fixes (63% of work). Contributed sporadically on just 4 days this month while also providing 2 code reviews and participating in discussions with 4 comments across PRs and issues.

tercel: Merged three PRs in a single day of activity this month, including enhancements to message handling (#4508), refactoring model handling in AgentRuntime (#4507, +56/-16 lines), and fixing Twitter functionality (#4506). The contributions show a balanced mix of feature work, refactoring, and fixes, totaling +88/-29 lines of code changes across 8 files.

Dahka2321: Made three documentation improvements this month, fixing broken links and image paths in the project's documentation. Merged PRs include updating a broken image path in the Thai README (#4433), fixing Eliza documentation links (#4460), and removing a broken release link in the changelog (#4527). All contributions were documentation-focused, with a total of 4 lines changed across 3 files.

michavie: Fixed ESM type generation issues across multiple packages with PR #4442 (+2473/-1637 lines), which modified 11 configuration files. This bugfix effort addressed problems in the SQL, Bootstrap, and OpenAI packages, representing their only contribution this month. Activity was sporadic, occurring on just 2 days in the period.

ai16z-demirix: Focused on test setup and coverage work with one open PR (#4481) that modified 72 files (+2120/-2067 lines). Contributed 11 commits primarily focused on tests (88%) and configuration files (13%). Provided 2 review comments on PRs, showing sporadic activity on just 3 days this month.

Y4NK33420: Opened one pull request (#4574) focused on implementing Polygon Gas Oracle Integration, which remains open. Made moderate code changes across 9 files (+291/-41 lines) in a single commit, with work distributed across tests (33%), configuration (33%), and code (22%). Activity was limited to a single day this month.
Samarthsinghal28: Opened one pull request (#4573) titled "Added : Polygon Plugin" which remains under review. No other activity was observed during this period.

HarshModi2005: Opened one pull request (#4575 "Issue 451") that remains unmerged, making substantial code changes across 34 files (+6112/-1217 lines) in a single day of activity this month. The changes were distributed across code (38%), configuration files (29%), and tests (26%), representing a significant contribution despite the limited activity period.

bowtiedbluefin: Opened one PR (#4466) to create a Morpheus plugin, making significant code changes across 11 files (+750/-10687 lines). Activity was limited to a single day this month, with the PR remaining open and receiving 4 comments from the author. The work primarily involved configuration (40%) and code (30%) changes, suggesting a substantial refactoring or cleanup effort given the large number of removed lines.

monilpat: Opened one PR (#4449) focused on adding polygon functionality, with substantial code changes across 83 files (+7338/-1907 lines). Made 10 commits with a primary focus split between other work (50%) and bugfix work (30%). Activity was sporadic, being active on only 4 days this month.

eveneast: Made a small documentation improvement by removing a redundant word in the Solana v2 documentation, with PR #4520 (+1/-1 lines) being merged. The contribution was focused entirely on documentation cleanup. Active on only one day this month with two nearly identical PRs submitted (one of which was merged).

harperaa: Fixed two bugs this month, with one merged PR (#4537, +32/-4 lines) addressing an error related to TEXT_EMBEDDING and one open PR (#4557) fixing the community manager plugin configuration. Contributed to discussions by commenting on 3 PRs and 3 issues. Activity was sporadic, concentrated on a single day with a focus entirely on bugfix work.

HashWarlock: Made a single focused contribution this month with PR #4572 "fix: TEE update for CI" (+381/-173 lines) which was successfully merged. The work involved configuration changes across 6 files, with a total of 4 commits showing a mix of feature work (50%), bug fixes (25%), and other changes (25%). Activity was limited to a single day this month, suggesting a targeted contribution rather than ongoing development.

Mylookingisverynormal: Made a single documentation contribution this month with PR #4483, which updated README.md with a one-line addition. This was their only activity during the period, representing a minimal but focused documentation improvement.

imholders: Opened one pull request (#4567) to add a Malaysian README file, with modifications to 4 files totaling +205/-1 lines. Activity was limited to a single day this month, with contributions split evenly between documentation and configuration files.

vtjl10: Merged a single PR (#4470) focused on fixing typos and improving dependencies management, with substantial changes (+52,446/-24,025 lines). Made minor documentation changes across 1 file (+4/-4 lines). Activity was limited to a single day this month.
Dangoz: Made a single documentation fix this month with PR #4443 "docs: fix title spacing" (+1/-1 lines), which was merged after 16 hours.

rnkrtt: Opened two documentation-related PRs this month: #4441 to fix typos and #4555 to repair a broken Quickstart link. Made modest documentation changes across 5 files (64 lines added, 64 removed) through 5 commits, with activity concentrated on just 3 days. Also contributed one comment on a pull request.

Pronoss: Contributed a single open pull request (#4563) focused on documentation improvements, fixing typos in the faq-and-support.md file with minimal changes (+2/-2 lines). Activity was limited to a single day this month with just one commit.

zeevick10: Made a single contribution this month with an open pull request (#4419) to update Character.md, consisting of a modest change (+1/-1 lines). Activity was very limited, with contributions on only one day during the period.
github-advanced-security: Minimal activity this month with only a single code review comment provided. No pull requests, issues, or code changes were made during this period.

plvo: Reported issue #4457 regarding a unicode escape error in pglite logs, which has since been closed. Participated in issue discussions with one comment. No code contributions or pull request activity this month.

TheDeveloperTom: Created a single issue (#4432) titled "Job: looking for a developer with Eliza framework experience," which has since been closed. No other activity was observed this month, with no code contributions, pull requests, or comments on any issues or PRs.

BinaryBluePeach: Opened issue #4536 regarding a module import problem. Participated in discussions by commenting on 2 issues. Activity was limited to issue tracking with no code contributions this month.

AndreaRettaroli: Opened one issue this month (#4528) regarding improvements to Eliza in TEE oasis, which remains open. No other activity was observed during this period.
